originalPost.name: Tomato
originalPost.content: Great plant! Grows exceptionally well in New York
originalPost.author: John Doe

comment2.content: Yes a great plant, but be sure to watch our for animals and pests. They always seem to be attracted to the bright red color
comment2.author: Sydney Johnson

originalPost.name: Basil
originalPost.content: Love having fresh herbs at home. I moved it inside for the winter and its still growing!
originalPost.author: Jane Doe

comment1.content: Yes goes great in my salds
comment1.author: Jake Dough

comment2.content: Very easy to grow and i love to pickle them.
comment2.author: Janet Dough

originalPost.name: Apple
originalPost.content: Not an easy plant to grow at home. Too much maintence would not recommend
originalPost.author: Jared Doe

comment1.content: I also had trouble with this plant any tips??
comment1.author: Jake Dough

comment2.content: Try having a bit of growing space between each plant! Also don't forget to water frequently. I hope that helps
comment2.author: Janice Dough

comment3.content: You can also add some wires to help support the plants as they grow. This is a challenging plant and may take a few tries to do so successfully. You have got this.
comment3.author: Jamie Doe

originalPost.name: Oranges
originalPost.content: These do not grow well here! It is much too cold. I would recommend if you live down south!
originalPost.author: Jason Doe

comment1.content: Why would you try to grow oranges in NY?!?!
comment1.author: Janer Dough

originalPost.name: Beans
originalPost.content: Always a hit or miss for me! Any recommendations on consitency
originalPost.author: Jon Doe

comment1.content: Yes! I always say with beans: WATER WATER WATER
comment1.author: Jan Dough

originalPost.name: Pumpkins
originalPost.content: I've never grown a pumpkin before. A very cool and challenging experience
originalPost.author: Jonathan Doe

comment1.content: I've been trying. They are always smaller than I would like though
comment1.author: Jane Dough
